Survival of the Best Fit

Play the Game

The Game

Survival of the Best Fit is an educational game to teach the public about how blind usage of AI can inherit human biases and further inequality. In the game, users learn about bias in automated hiring, as they play as a startup CEO who's under a lot of pressure to grow a company. At first, they start by selecting the best candidates manually, but with overwhelming pressure and workload, resort to employing an AI system that they don't fully understand. The black box seems to be working at first, hiring much faster at a lower cost, but slowly the unforeseen consequences come bearing down.

Supported by the Creative Media Award from Mozilla Foundation. Built by Gabor, Jihyun, Miha, and Alia.

Because AI is not neutral

Technology needs to be built with an awareness of its potential social and ethical implications. Much of the public debate on the development of AI has presented it as a threat imposed on us, rather than one that we have agency over. We want to change this by helping users understand the technology and demanding more transparency and accountability from those building increasingly pervasive machine learning systems. We want to break down the barrier between the average user and technologies they may deem too complicated to question.
